title: 105_hr1945
content: SUSPENSION OF DUTY ON CERTAIN MANUFACTURING EQUIPMENT. Subchapter II of chapter 99 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended by inserting new headings. "9902.84.79 Calendaring or other rolling machines for rubber, valued at not less than $2,200,000 each, numerically controlled." The curr_chunk mentions parts and material holding devices for specific subheadings 8420.10.90, 8420.91.90, or 8420.99.90. Shearing machines for cutting metallic tissue are included in subheading 9902.84.81. Shearing machines for cutting metallic tissue are included in subheading 9902.84.81. The machines can make straight cuts of 5 meters or more, valued at not less than $750,000 each, and are numerically controlled. Subheading 9902.84.83 includes machine tools for working wire of iron or steel for use in products. No changes are made to this subheading on or before 12/31/2000. Subheading 9902.84.83 includes machine tools for working wire of iron or steel for use in products, valued at not less than $375,000 each, numerically controlled. Subheading 9902.84.85 covers extruders used for processing. Rubber valued at $2,000,000 each, numerically controlled, or parts thereof, provided for in subheading 9902.84.85. Machinery for molding, retreading, or forming uncured rubber (8477.20.00 or 8477.90.80) with no changes before 12/31/2000. Unvulcanized rubber for processing products under subheading 4011.20.10, valued at not. Unvulcanized rubber products valued at less than $800,000 each, capable of holding cylinders measuring 114 centimeters or more in size. Unvulcanized rubber products capable of holding large cylinders, with specific subheadings for diameter control parts. Sector mold press machines used for curing or vulcanizing rubber, valued at not less than $1,000,000 each. Sector mold press machines used for curing or vulcanizing rubber, weighing 135,000 kg or more, numerically controlled, or parts thereof (provided for in subheading 8477.90.80). Sawing machines valued at $600,000 each, weighing 18,000 kg or more, for working cured materials. Sawing machines for working cured materials, including vulcanized rubber, described in heading 4011, with no changes before 12/31/2000. The amendment made by subsection (a) applies to goods entered or withdrawn from warehouse for consumption 15 days after the enactment of the Act. Retroactive application is allowed for certain entries of goods described in specific subheadings of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States made on or after May 1, 1997, with a proper request filed before the 90th day after the enactment of the Act. Entries or withdrawals of goods made on or after May 1, 1997, but before the 15th day after the enactment of this Act, will be treated as if they occurred 15 days after the enactment of the Act.
